solution_line_template: The difference in age between the two sisters is {rachel_age_initial} - {emily_age_initial} = <<{rachel_age_initial}-{emily_age_initial}={age_difference}>>{age_difference} years.
When Rachel is twice Emily's age, she is {age_difference} x {multiplier_for_twice} = <<{multiplier_for_twice}*{age_difference}={rachel_age_when_emily_half}>>{rachel_age_when_emily_half} years old.
